overview: Students will learn how to interpret focused clinical ultrasound assessment of early pregnancy problems and pelvic pain and how to write an interpretive ultrasound report. Students will critically interpret and write a report on 10 online focused early pregnancy and basic gynaecology ultrasound studies.
ilo: Describe the indications, uses and limitations of focused clinical ultrasound in assessment of early pregnancy problems and pelvic pain.
Interpret and write a structured interpretive report of focused clinical ultrasound for early pregnancy problems and pelvic pain.
Evaluate the requirements for training, competence and certification in early pregnancy and basic gynaecology ultrasound.
generic_skills: Improved written skills and problem-solving skills

Prerequisites.content: Note: these can be taken concurrently (at the same time)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Adequate visual acuity is required to interpret clinical ultrasound. A student is expected to demonstrate sufficient visual acuity to perform the required range of skills, including reading ultrasound images from a computer monitor.

assessment.brief: Interpretation of 10 case studies assessed by structured questions pertaining to each case
